oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-11-18 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 18, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Ford Rush, and Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording ends with the start of the following Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jack Shook; Missouri Mountaineers; Ford Rush; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Old Age Pension Check (Roy Acuff) [continued from part 1] -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers -- Tumbling Tumbleweeds (Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Shine On Harvest Moon (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Shucking Of The Corn (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers -- When A Boy From The Mountains (Weds A Girl From The Valley) (Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- New Greenback Dollar (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- Closing theme (Give The Fiddler A Dram) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone) -- Station announcements -- Opening statement (George D. Hay)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Shook, Jack; Missouri Mountaineers (Musical group)
